Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious but location not great”
Reviews.Author: goswanniez
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedrooms apartment, very clean and big, nice and comfortable. The location is great for the Sydney cricket ground (20 minute walk) but a taxi is required to go to the city. Apartment block is very big so it takes a good 10 minutes to walk from reception to your apartment and wait for 3 lifts in our case. Not bad but I've stayed in better meritons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: whittakerc
Reviews.Content: The Meriton Apartments were a delight to stay in. We are travelling extensively through Australia and have stayed in many hotels, apartments and motels some were nice and some not so nice. The Meriton was the best by far and definitely worth the price. Clean, secure and modern with all the amenities you need, close to Coles so we could buy groceries and bring them back to the apartment. Only downsides, no early check in option, shuttle from airport and no free wifi. Definitely NOT deal breakers. Would recommend highly. Thank you Meriton!

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nambourlady
Reviews.Content: I booked a two bedroom apartment for a business weekend for four women travelling from interstate for a meeting. The king size beds were suitable for room sharing, and the two bathrooms worked well. The apartment was very spacious and well-equipped. There was a huge Coles supermarket open late just down the street with an excellent range of fresh and gourmet foods. The only drawback was that this property is not on the train line, and taxi transport to and from the city was expensive. Bus transport might have been an option. There is a pool and gym accessible offsite but we did not visit these. This venue was a very good alternative to similar quality but much more expensive accommodation downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Surry Hills and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lp2026
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying here when I need to be in the Eastern Suburbs. Very comfortable however do try and get a room away from the Expressway. Rates can also be very competitive. Not sure If I would consider this 5 star property- not why I stay here

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated, home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jenny G
Reviews.Content: We've just spent the last 6 weeks in this excellent serviced apartment while my husband underwent medical treatment at St Vincent's Hospital & Clinic in Darlinghurst. The proximity to the hospital is fantastic, with only a 10 minute trip to & fro. We knew before we booked that this block of apartments fronted the Eastern Distrubutor, one of the busiest motorways in Sydney, but with double-glazed windows in the bedroom, the noise from the road wasn't an issue. Our apartment (1008) which was split level and had the added benefit of a powder room adjacent to the living area, had a great view over Moore Park Golf Course and across to Bondi Junction. However, this particular apartment was adjacent to some sort of mechanical equipment (possibly a large air conditioning unit) which meant there was a constant motor-type noise present. It certainly would have been more pleasant had this noise not been there but having said that, at least it wasn't a noise that cut in and out ..... that would have been really difficult to tolerate. Located downstairs was the bedroom which had a king-sized bed. The enormous bathroom with its bath and separate shower, also had a full sized washing machine, dryer & laundry tub. The apartment also had a small study located at the foot of the stairs and this was a great place to store our luggage but the noise from the aforementioned machinery made it unpleasant to use for its intended purpose. We found that we often needed to use the air-conditioning units in the bedroom & the living room as for most of the time the noise from the traffic was just too great with the windows & sliding doors open. However, this wasn't an issue for us because by using the air-conditioning we were able to deep Sydney's extreme summer humidity at bay! The kitchen had all the appliances necessary to self-cater but only just enough china to get us through the day. It was great to have the full-sized gas cooktop to cook on and I also appreciated having the dishwasher. We took advantage of the long-term $10 per night parking and felt very comfortable leaving our car in the enormous carpark as it was regularly patrolled by security staff. We were able to park right at the lift which made moving in & out as easy as possible. Our situation during this visit didn't allow us the freedom to wander around this Danks St area but there were many, many cafes close by and also a Coles supermarket which was very handy. There was also a chemist and a medical centre. Not far away was the Surry Hills Shopping Village in which there was another Coles supermarket, as well as a post office and numerous other small shops & cafes. A regular bus service runs from a stop just near Coles, with the 301, 302, & 303 all going to the city. There were only a couple of minor issues that stopped me clicking on the 5th dot in this review. We felt that the TV reception was very poor, despite the efforts of the staff to rectify this situation. We assume this was because all the channels came through Foxtel. There were only 5 free to air Sydney channels, but none of the digital Freeview channels were available. A lighted magnifying mirror in the bathroom would have been of great benefit to we "over 60 year olds" with failing eyesight! As my husband was so ill, we were unable to take advantage of the daily 'light' housekeeping so we can't comment on this service. While we didn't have much need for contact with the reception staff, when we did they were extremely helpful & pleasant, especially Koo who always had a smile on his face and for whom nothing was too much trouble! We have no hesitation in recommending the Meriton Danks St as a great place to stay and we'll certainly stay there again should the need arise.

Reviews.Title: “Very much at home in this serviced apartment”
Reviews.Author: Highadventurer
Reviews.Content: Have to book well in advance to get good rates and the serviced apartment has the amenties as home eg laundry, full kitchen and fridge. Street parking as with most of Sydney is difficult and it is difficukt to save the the $20 overnight parking. We took a duplex and it is very cosy with a big lounge and dinning area.

Reviews.Title: “Great serviced apartment, cellphone signal a problem”
Reviews.Author: billbennettoz
Reviews.Content: The only thing that would stop me using this serviced apartment more is that it's very difficult to get cell phone signal in certain rooms. And so Internet access is limited as well. The location is close to some terrific restaurants and coffee shops, and very close to the airport. The Meriton chain of serviced apartments have got their act together and the rooms are well equipped and reasonably priced. Street parking is difficult but there's undercover parking which is extra cost but your car is safe. The rooms are quiet and there are good take away restaurants nearby too. As I say, the cellphone signal deficit is the only downside.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with caution”
Reviews.Author: 11Herewegoagain11
Reviews.Content: When checking in I wanted to put my $100 bond down in cash and the lady seemed very hesitant to do so and then came up with every reason so I had to give my credit card details. Nearly 2 weeks after I left I still didn't get my bond back but instead an invoice charging me $100 for carpet cleaning which they debited from my credit card. I was only awake in the hotel for a maximum of 2 hours during my stay and when I spoke to management they proceeded to tell me there were stains on the carpet and I signed over authority for them to charge me if anything was left unsatisfactory. They sent me pics but I had nothing in the room even of the same colour as a mini little mark that looks like it could have been wiped off with a cloth. The pictures did not prove it was me, the apartment I stayed in or even their hotel for that matter they could have been taken anywhere and I know truthfully that I did not leave the hotel room in any condition other than exactly the way I entered it in. Please just beware.

Reviews.Title: “As Promised - Reasonable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: peterkar
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay.... Reception was warm and welcoming, and a couple of small problems (with air conditioning and bathroom) were fixed without fuss while we were out in the morning. Perhaps greater attention could be paid to the "How to" section of the guest compendium. Although we were travelling light, we still had a big impact on the bedroom, which seemed somewhat small for a king-sized bed and our luggage. Closet/wardrobe space was excellent, however. We were afraid of noise levels, based on others' comments and the fact that we were close to a swimming pool which seemed to attract drunken youngsters; however, they were gone before 11pm and there was nothing to interrupt our sleep. The fit out seemed adequate if unremarkable, as long as there aren't more than four of you wanting a glass of wine/cup of coffee etc at once. Location is excellent when you know where you are! In fact, you are in a block which is a very small part of an area occupied by similar blocks with permanent residents, so that there is a good supermarket (Coles) about 100 metres along the road, and a variety of shops including a newsagent which sells bus tickets - the Sydney bus system is remarkably simple and inexpensive. Outside the newsagent - more or less - is the bus stop where buses on four lines will take you into the city. If one fancies some exercise, it is only a ten minute walk to Surry Hills, one of Sydney's prime shopping and restaurant areas.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service I have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: catwater
Reviews.Content: I will never be staying in this hotel again. The service was absolutely appauling and I'm not sure how any human being can speak to another with such little respect the way I was spoken to. I have stayed at the Meriton on numerous occasions and can safely say that after my previous exeperience (1-2 October), that will surely be my last. I HIGHLY suggest that those wanting to spend a fortune go elsewhere, as the amount we paid and the service we received was absolutely shocking. The way we were spoken to by reception and the security guards was absolutely disgusting and their behaviour was completely unprofessional and I was left highly offended. I will surely be seeking further action regarding the Meriton's security guards, their services and their future position at the Meriton. I do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay !”
Reviews.Author: PremThailand
Reviews.Content: Stayed in other Meritons before and expected Meriton to be standard. But this must be their worse one. The reception is the most unhelpful and rude. The rooms located on this floor that anyone can have access to is the most unsafe. I think it is the 4th level. The rooms were old and i had to sleep with the kids because i did not feel the hotel was safe. It is full of people who are having private parties on the weekends. Not a family hotel ! It is so badly located. We had a car and could never get anywhere because there was traffic from all sides. The retaurants on the streets were alright, nothing facinating. No train stations nearby and no taxi stand either. If you have another choice, stay somewhere else. It will be worth your money to pay a little extra and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very good apartments in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mv18829
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times, the last in July 2011. The apartments are right next to the Eastern Distributor so finding it was very easy. I've driven each time and the secured carpark is great at $20/per day. I first stayed in a one-bedroom apartment, but they tend to have the unusual arrangement of the living areas (incl. TV) on one level and the bedroom on a mezzanine, which get tiring after a while. So for all future trips have opted for a studio apartment which was much better. The apartments themselves were clean, well appointed and quiet as long as you kept the balcony door shut. Otherwise the noise from the Eastern carries straight through. On the negative side, this set of apartments includes alot of permanent residents. So the rental part is somewhat of a rabbit warren to get through and can get tedious is you have luggage to move. Overall the pros outweigh the cons. The staff were always helpful and it is surrounded by a good selection of shops, cafes and restaurants and is only 15 min from Sydney airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Smithy013
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our two adult children. Spacious two bedroom apartment , modern facilities and enormous kitchen. Split level which meant we all had plenty of space. Yes you are right on the freeway but windows are double glazed and its not a problem. Great location for the city. We were able to walk to the SCG for the AFL. There is a shopping complex with some restaurants half a block away and you also have use of shared facilities like a gym. Easy to catch buses or taxis into town. Front desk staff not all that friendly and corridors can be noisy but generally we felt it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Well Equipped and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: j0belly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for a night with a group of 8 friends. We booked 2 x 2 bedroom apartments. Having 2 bathrooms in each apartment is really handy when a bunch of ladies are rooming together! The apartments are well equipped in the kitchen area and spacious. Full size fridge, stove, dishwashers, microwave and all the cutlery, crockery etc you could need to self cater. We stay here at least once a year to attend annual events and cannot find a better option for our needs - reasonable price, handy to restaurants, supermarket just arond the corner and quiet. Only downside I can think of is there is only one lift in the lobby and it gets very busy during check-in/checkout times.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant place to be”
Reviews.Author: Travejnk
Reviews.Content: It's an ok place to stay if you don't mind drunk people all around the complex returning from their nights out. Singing, peeing and dragging themselves slowly thru the corridors. All this is quite an entertaining show I guess. However the worst part of the hotel is absolutely incompetent staff. Rude, untrained and extremely lazy. Reception desk service is that of a backpacker hotel. I guess that's the reason it's more of a place for Chinese tourists renting 10+ people in a room or young, drunk and loud locals. Wouldn't stay here again. Lovation is good, close to everything. However the experience with stuff in the hotel itself is a terrible one.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but beware the traffic.”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_Stewart
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many different Meriton properties. This one is is quite like the others, it have a very Meriton feel to it - same sort of furnishings and quality of fit out. Danks St was newish, and the rooms were clean & comfortable, if a bit smaller than other Meriton's I've stayed at. Service was OK. The location is OK, opposite Moore Park. The development containing the hotel and 1000's of other residential apartment blocks is a reclaimed industrial site. It has a weird 'cookie cutter' vibe to it, which we felt was very un-Sydney like. There are a handful of dining options, but you would be better off jumping in a cab & heading up the road to the city. The downsides to the property were the proximity to South Dowling St. Many apartments directly overlook it. Which, if you are a heavy sleeper (as I am) will not be a problem. If not, I would imagine that sleeping would be difficult. Even though there is double glazing, the traffic noise is very noticeable. The other thing I didn't like was that the Gym and Pool are in a separate shared facility, about a five minute walk away. The pool was quite nice. The gym was run down with much of the equipment either broken or in dis-repair, but this seems pretty standard for hotel gyms these days.

Reviews.Title: “Plently of room, spotless, close to shops and noise not a problem in back rooms”
Reviews.Author: nicket
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve stayed here a few times and itâ€™s one of our first choices near Sydney airport. Itâ€™s close to shops, take out and casual restaurants. The parking is cheap too compared to other Sydney hotels (only $20 per night). The two-bedroom apartments are comfortable for two couples â€“ the living area separates the two bedrooms and each one has its own bathroom. The apartment has a full-sized kitchen. The laundry is also handy for any quick washing between trips. It also comes at a good value tariff. A few reviews have mentioned the traffic noise. These apartments are on one of Sydneyâ€™s busiest roads and thereâ€™s no way you could sleep with the windows/doors open if you were in a front room. However, we were upgraded to a two bedroom apartment and stayed in the â€˜back bedroomâ€™ which looks over the back of the hotel instead of the road. So noise wasnâ€™t a problem for us. I noticed that the front bedroom has two sliding doors (double glazing) so Iâ€™m guessing this might cut down the noise to an OK level. All, in all, we will definitely stay here again. Also, if youâ€™re after a great breakfast, wander down the road to Wah Wah Lounge at 1 Danks St â€“ genuinely friendly service, lovely food and a sunny spot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but shut your windows!”
Reviews.Author: Mailmanwill
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay in Waterloo area as their are many restaurants and a pub on every corner! Spring in Canada but fall down under when we arrived with a 30.00 cab ride from the airport. Nice condo but you have to shut the windows because of the traffic noise.Used the fitness area every day and my wife loved the sauna. Very nice walking around the area but a little far from the "real" Sydney. I would stay again as I love buying fresh tuna for less than half the price as Canada and cooking it up with some yams in the small but not well equipped kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely surrounds, shame about the traffic”
Reviews.Author: SoulContender
Reviews.Content: Well located near buses and a short walk to cafes. Great facilities, sadly, it overlooks the Eastern Distributor motorway, so you are assured of loads of often noisy traffic from 5am until late, even on weekends. The cafe below also had a throbbing nightclub on a Saturday night, which is a strange location to have one under apartments in a residential area. Too much base for an early night with children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family friendly accommodation”
Reviews.Author: FrancisCrew
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to Sydney, travelling with my husband and two children aged 5 and 10 years. We had not stayed at any Merriton accommodation before and had no recommendations re this property however we would easily say that it exceeded expectations! From the friendly and prompt service when we arrived, to our surprise at the size of the apartment it was all a positive experience. We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom apartments which were huge, 2 bathrooms on two levels. Views from balconies on both sides of the apartment, fully equipped kitchen, laundry and loads of storage space. I was very impressed by the servicing of the apartments each day, the cleanliness and attention to detail were to be commended, they even loaded the dishwasher for us one day! The pools and spa are a short walk and are worth it with kids, very clean lots of fun, with a toddler pool also. Location is only 20 minutes by bus to CBD, bus stop is only 150 metres down the road and runs every 15 minutes. To be noted also is the many shops located within 100 metres of the apartments, Coles open from 7am til midnight every day, chemist, pizza shops, fruit and veg, cafes. Is also only about 15 minutes to the airport and about $20, we were conned on the way in and paid $49 dollars so make sure you check with the cabbie first! All in all we had a great trip and loved Sydney, is a very easy city to get around with kids. I guess the only thing to note about the apartment being on 2 levels is the stairs, with small children it may be an issue. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, if you adjust expectations”
Reviews.Author: BC001
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Meriton Waterloo with our two small children. Having a serviced apartment with its own kitchen and laundry facilities was a real necessity for us, as eating out with small kids is often not a pleasurable experience. The front desk service is average, nothing to write home about, but the rooms are good. I asked for a 2BR apartment on one level due to the kids, and the apartment was too small for my liking. However my partner had previous stayed in a 2BR split level apartment and he said it was HUGE. I had a peek in one when it was being cleaned, and we will definitely go with that next time. You basically have one master br with ensuite on the top level, then go down the stairs to a large kitchen/dining/living area and 2nd BR and bathroom. The location of the apartment is okay. Buses frequently go up Bourke St into the city where you can easily get connections to all of Sydney's sights. Sydney is huge so you are usually going to need to get public transport to the beach, zoo, city, wherever. I disagree with the reviewer who said you will need a car - you won't if you are travelling to the usual sightseeing places as these are well serviced by public transport. The apartments are clean, are serviced daily and are generally well equipped. There is a Coles supermarket about 100m away and a few take away options e.g. sushi, chicken shop, pizza etc. A few dine-in options on Danks St (some seemed quite nice). It is a great location if you need to get to or from the airport quickly - about 15 mins in a taxi. The noise didn't bother me too much. Provided you keep the windows closed, you won't be woken by the noise. The aircon units are plentiful (in living area and each BR) so will keep place cool in summer. There are not that many facilities within the complex compared to what you would get in a hotel - for example, no in-house restaurant or bar; gym and swimming pool are located off-site; also not sure if they have a business centre or other such facility. However as you have probably gathered the rates are quite competitive and it's probably due to the fact that they don't provide all these add-ons (which, to be honest, we didn't need anyway). Meriton now have a strict 'no party' policy which they seem to enforce. We stayed over the long weekend and while the place was fully booked, we found it very quiet. Overall, the place is a clean, convenient, utilitarian place to stay. However if you are new to Sydney and seeking a quintessential Sydney experience with a wonderful location and great service, it's probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, huge clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: judpriest
Reviews.Content: perfect stopover as we were in for the AFL the location right across from the hotel. Two story 2 bed apartments, everything new or never used. Full sized kitchen with all amenities diswasher etc air con, parking included in the rate which for $200 you will never get anything even close this good for a family of 5.You,d be lucky to find a cabin in a caravan park 30klms away for $200 in Sydney.Downsides are nothing really close re;shops restaraunts although there are a few a cab ride to KC,city would be in order. Also of note be quick if you want to get a parking spot as they go quick(ie if you get one then don,t move your vehicle until you checkout)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: KingDeepu
Reviews.Content: Clean & spacious rooms , safe parking & excellent location and service. Friendly staff and will recommend. Regards, King and Deepu

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the most unprofessional, poorly managed and dirty Meriton I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at the above reviews. I had previously accessed reviews of this property on Trip advisor which gave me cause for alarm, however these no longer appear on the site. I travelled to Meriton Waterloo on 10 October with my sister and teenage nephew. Despite my reservations, we made the booking based on the (somewhat) good name of Meriton. The booking was made using meritonapartments.com.au, and the rate was reasonable give the high demand for accommodation in Sydney that weekend. Our booking was for a two bedroom apartment and was made weeks in advance. When we arrived at the hotel we were initially advised that our reservation could not be found. After some minutes, the reservation was located, but we were advised by the receptionist that the "booking was not appearing on the daily running sheet". We were however assured that all was in order and was asked to return after 2pm to checkin. When we returned later that day we encountered major difficulties. First, it took nearly 15 minutes to be served. Second, when we were finally served the person we were dealing with did not seem to understand that we had already completed all necessary registration details. Third, once this was understood, the woman proceeded to advise that there were no 2 bedroom apartments available and that instead, we would have to take two one bedroom apartments. We advised that this was not acceptable and asked to speak to the manager. We noted that our booking had been made well in advance, and that if the had been a problem, that we should have been advised earlier in the day when we registered. The woman asked the manager to speak to us, but he was reluctant to do so. Instead, the woman asked "that we go to the rooms and that he would contact us later". As this was unacceptable, we demanded to speak to manager. After having to wait for a further 10 minutes (by now we had waited over 30 minutes) the manger came to see us and advised that the property was overbooked. After some discussion he agreed to "find" us a 2 bedroom apartment (why this could not have been done in the first place is anyones guess). We were finalluy allocated an apartment on the 14th floor. On initial inspection it looked fine, but once in we realised that the apartment was filthy. There was dust on all surfaces, the tiles in the bathrooms were filthy and there was a rotting stench coming from behind a locked door. Given the difficulties we put up with the accommodation. We checked out at 6.30am the next day. Upon check-out we were told that reception staff "do not start work until 7am". When I asked if I could pay, the "security" guard advised that it was "not his job" to take payment an that "the managemenet would deal with the matter late in the day". In short, this hotel is appallinglu run with poorly trained staff and filthy. I will never stay in this property, or indeed, any other Meriton property again. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Multiple stays, never a bad experience (except once....)”
Reviews.Author: wisend-traveller
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular guest with Meriton, with over 20 stays at their various locations in the last 12 months. For some reason, this apartment complex is almost always the cheapest of the Meriton flock. As always, their apartments are first class, I honestly can never fault them. The only real problem that I see is either - a) you get an inward-facing apartment, and you feel a little claustrophobic - completely surrounded by apartments; or b) you get an East facing unit, that overlooks the Easter Distributor. In the latter case, if you have a low floor, you will have road noise all night long. I have a running joke with the reception staff every time I check in - one guy always remembers my name, yet the girl always thinks I'm called Karl for some reason. Great place, as it it right on the ED, so is easy to get to pretty much anywhere around town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Discovery”
Reviews.Author: TCGGrafton
Reviews.Content: Not a great fan of staying in the CITY . As we have stayed in Meriton Gold Coast and loved that so much we decided to stay here when on a quick visit to Sydney. The staff were great and the service was equal to the Gold Coast , a little tricky to find if you are driving, but the proximity to Fox Studios (Brent St Dance) was very very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: smithie01
Reviews.Content: stayed at the meriton apartments (south dowling street) directly behind and shadowed by moore park gardens .If you want to stay a wake all night with traffic noise and never have sunlight in your apartment then meriton apartments in moorepark are the place for you.Bad reception-not interested,poor security -never seen and general noise of fellow neighbouring guests who are heard thru the paper thin walls.Was booked in for 3 nights and stayed for 2 reluctantly with pillow over head most nights.Air conditioning not in full power.Had to leave windows open-thus allowing traffic noise and mosquitos.Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere in the city.Definately not in walking distance of sydney cbd or any happening places. No photos wouldn't waste film

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment...not such a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gemzy85
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in a split floor two bed apartment at Meriton Danks Street middle of January. After an exausting flight we arrived 9am....and although check in wasn't until the afternoon we were able to check in early thanks to the reception guy. We were very surprised at the size of the apartment...it was huge, 1 onsuite bedroom on the first floor, comfortable bed and lovely big bathroom with separate shower and bath, a second on suite bedroom upstairs along with the living area. The living area had a large flat screen tv, sofa, arm chair and a dining table.The kitchen was fully equipped dishwasher, cooking area fridge freezer etc and laundry facilities (washer & dryer). Tea & coffee was available. There was also a large balcony with seating area just off the living room. Cleanliness was to a high standard and staff were always pleasant allowing us to leave our luggage after checkout. The only disappointment was the location, fine if you have a car, but as we didn't we had to use public transport to get to circular Quay. Not a great amount happening close to the apartments, a few small cafes thats about it, but seems to be an up and coming area with lots of building going on! There is a swimming pool/spa available for guests to use about 1 min walk from danks street in another Meriton complex but can not comment on this as we didn't have time to use it. The apartment was ideal for our needs, and we would stay there again. Good if your only stopping in sydney for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars without the fussing”
Reviews.Author: dboycey
Reviews.Content: The apartment was as nice as a five star hotel, but with a fully equiped kitchen and at a tenth of the price. We paid Â£40 a night for 4 nights and basicly we couldn't believe our luck. Nice lounge, comfy bed, big bathroom. Balcony. It is about a 15 minute bus ride away from the CBD, but the value for money makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Todd_82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom apartment for 3 nights. Was actually a 2 bedroom with one of the rooms locked off. The apartments were gorgeous, huge bed, great bathroom - excellent shower! I had a corner apartment so had a wrap-around balcony. I was a little worried about the area - but it is a safe neighbourhood with lots of places to eat within 2-3 minutes walk. The pool complex was amazing - didn't use the gym but it looked good. It is a fair distance from the city, but the bus stop is just around the corner and its $2.90 to get to Circular Quay. $15 cab ride from the airport - can't complain! You can walk to Surry Hills (about 15 minutes), and there is a Coles supermarket at Baptist/Cleveland Streets which is about 10 minutes walk away. All in all - it was a great place to stay - next time would probably stay closer to town, but for the price and quality of this complex - its a great deal, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Geared towards extended stays, not tourists looking for charm”
Reviews.Author: DeSpanish
Reviews.Content: The Meriton Cameo Apartments are located in a part of town that is really rather nondescript. You donâ€™t feel at all like youâ€™re in Sydney. The apartments are clean, light, and spacious with out door balconies. They have kitchens and washer/dryer units. During my stays, there was never a maid service. And check in both times was slow. The gym was adequate but the pool facility was OUTSTANDING! One of the most beautiful lap pools Iâ€™ve ever worked out in. My only dislike was really the location. If this is not an issue you should be fine. To get to Sydney Harbor you have to call a cab, which sometimes takes 15-20 minutes to arrive. The cost will range from $15 (to the harbor) or $25 (to the Sydney Opera House at curtain time.) Getting a cab after the performance took a little while. Additionally, there is no WiFi connection and Internet (Broadband) is not cheap. Food is also expensive. The CrÃ¨me CafÃ© served excellent omelets and the proprietor is just lovely. I also found some lovely cafes after a walk down Burke Street along with an organic grocer and a nice produce market. Although as a single traveler I felt safe, one of my cab drivers mentioned that Waterloo was not one of the safest neighborhoods in Sydney. If I return, I would definitely try to book a hotel closer to downtown but if that is not an issue for you, the Meriton is a solid hotel, just not a charming one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: SwamiBami
Reviews.Content: The 3 bed room turned out to be a suite! Kitchenette incl. dishwasher, bathroom, washing machine and dryer were in perfect shape. The quality of the decoration and furniture was very good! 15 minutes per bus to the Opera House and the ferries!

Reviews.Title: “Where do we start....LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen78
Reviews.Content: Where do we start....we loved this place. Sheer luxury. I can only comment on our experience and we were very, very lucky. Arrived at the Meriton Cameo from the aiport for a 5 night stay after spending 3 weeks travelling down the East Coast. We had stayed in Budget places and we booked in advance a 2 bedrm apartment for 4 adults based on reviews I read on here. We worked out before we left the UK it was around Â£16 each/night and that suited our budget. I think the taxi trip cost us around $30 but I think we were charged extra as we had a bigger car for loads of luggage. We were taken right to the main building which looked exactly like we expected. Modern building about 10 storeys high. Went into the recpetion area which was small but clean and modern and checked in. We wanted to pay our accommodation by cash, and Dad being Dad was not keen on us paying up front without seeing the room. We did however pay the $830 approx upfront, and we were given our key for the 10th floor. The key also activated the lift. We got in the lift, up to Floor 10 & the doors opened & we saw our room was to the right. At that point I noticed there were only 4 rooms on the floor but never really thought much of it. Mum went in the door first & immediately turned to me with her mouth wide open!! It was HUGE!! we went in & my Dad immediately bagan to panic that we had paid $830 & that was for the one night but no, the receipt definitely said 5 nights. The kitchen was so modern & fancy, big living & dining room area, big bedroom with en-suite, a bedroom with 2 beds, another bathroom and a utility room with washing machine & tumble dryer. We went out on the patio & you could have held a massive party on it!!! We were absolutely stunned. We found out a few days later that we had been upgraded to a penthouse suite. We have no idea why, but it was luxury. We used the pool facilities once which were in the building opposite & were lovely. I have nothing negative to say about these apartments. Yes they are a bit away from the centre of Sydney but there are buses frequently from a bus stop just across the road. Surrey Hills is a short journey away & although we did not go out there to eat, there seemed to be plenty to chose from. Our favourite restaurant was down at Darling Harbour & was called Baia. Gorgeous! Our stay might not have been as good if we hadn't got such a gorgeous suite, but I cannot comment on that. Would go back again if I was in Sydney & chance my luck again for an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSoldier
Reviews.Content: Great Place for the Price!! The apartments our brand new and have everything you could possibly need. It is about a 8 min drive to the city center, but a taxi was always near by. Reception was great and helpful. If you are looking for an affordable place without missing out on amenities, this place is for you. Very spacious and clean. Cheap parking compared to other locations as well, $15. The room had it all good size TV, DVD, couch, nice bed, washer/dryer, full kithen, stero system, etc. Again, it is a few minutes from the city, but what you get for the price makes it all worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service.....never again”
Reviews.Author: GucciGalSydney
Reviews.Content: Well were do i start. Firstly we arrived around 1pm to check in and reception would not check us in until 2pm on the dot! when we checked in the room was not cleaned properly with food on the kitchen bench! When i initally checked i asked for 2 rooms one with a double and one with 2 singles. We did not get the 2 singles but instead got a double. They were not helpful at all. The staff at this hotel are very rude and even sending a complaint email to the General Manager i did not recieve any follow up! Coming from the hospitality industry myself i was appalled by the unprofessionalism by this hotel. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Boring High Rise”
Reviews.Author: JangoMelbourne
Reviews.Content: If you like staying in among a collection of high rise apartments with absolutely no character in the middle of an industrial zone which could be in any city in the world, this is for you. I booked a two bedroom apartment via Wotif, believing their blurb that it was close by the city. It's not. The buses come every half hour and it's a $15 for taxi ride to the CBD. Returning from the CBD late in the evening was downright scary with nobody around. The wind whistled through the badly made doors all night making an incredible noise. I couldn't connect my computer via dialup and it was implied that it was my computer's fault, even though I have been on the road for a month staying in various serviced apartments and haven't ever had a problem with dial up. I tried to cancel the reservation as soon as I walked in the door realizing that I'd made a big mistake, but having booked with WOTIF they would not consider a cancellation. Being so far out of the buzz of the city or the charm of the inner suburbs made it a miserable time for me in Sydney, and I'll never again book via WOTIF or with an apartment/hotel which is really just in the selling/leasing business, not the hospitality business.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Cheahwc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a three bedroom unit from 26 to 30Nov. Best hotel, best value place we stayed while we travelled in Australia. Paid A$201 per night + A$15 per day for parking. The unit are very well maintain and everthing in tip top condition. We love this place. will stay here again. The front desk is small and difficult to find though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: brando8119
Reviews.Content: A few friends of mine, including myself, stayed here three or four times during the two years I lived in Australia. The place that we rented was very very nice, spacous, about six or seven stories high with a wonderful view of the city street (nothing breath-taking or anything, but it was nice). We had a very pleasant stay there every time. The only thing that I thought was weird was how the desk clerk(s) would always look at you like they thought you were hiding something and they were going to find out....kind of funny though. Alltogether great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Ellzer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night prior to leaving Australia. We had previously been in Sydney for 1 week and stayed in the City Centre. First of all, the Meriton was an extremely good deal especially given the amount of space, the cleanliness, and the amenities. It really is an apartment, not a hotel room, and there is a fully-outfitted kitchen as as well as a separate laundry room with detergent included. Excellent for long-term stays but was great for a short stay like ours, too. It was really nice to have an actual couch to sit on to watch TV, etc. There was a convenience store and 4-5 ethnic restaurants nearby (the pizza at the Middle Eastern corner one was fantastic), as well as a DVD rental store (the apartment has a DVD player). The apartment is pretty convenient to Centennial Park and to the Paddington area. Too far to walk to City Centre, though, let alone the Harbor (our hotel in City Centre allowed us to walk to Darling Harbor and even to Circular Quay when we weren't too tired). However, it is well-positioned in terms of cabfare, generally about A$10 to most areas of the city, with fare to the airport <$20 (we didn't realize this and took the train in from the airport, then a cab, very roundabout and well over $30!). The front desk people were very courteous and helpful, as well. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: KKRH85
Reviews.Content: Was very roomy and comfortable. King bed was wonderful. Appliances were top notch. Very clean. A video store with inexpensive internet access was about a block away. An absolutely fantastic place for the price. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's top shelf!”
Reviews.Author: Thommo84
Reviews.Content: What a great find! I recently travelled to Sydney with my girlfriend for the weekend, where we stayed at Meriton Cameo for two nights. What a great place to stay! Location - It was only a $14 taxi fare from the airport (15 mins), and buses to Circular Quay (301, 302, 303) leave regularly from just around the corner (Bourke St), and it's only a 15-20min trip. There are countless pubs and restaurants on Crown St in Surry Hills, which is a very short walk away (25 mins to the most distant we visited at Foveaux St), and even shorter on the bus. The $10 steak at Forresters was excellent, and we were impressed with every one of the bars we visited. We also walked home during the early hours of the morning, and never once felt unsafe. Fox studios and the SCG/Aussie Stadium are about a 30min walk, and Bondi is not far on a bus. There is also a handy 24hr convenience store in Potter St, which is surprisingly well stocked, and fairly inexpensive. Room/Facilities - Our room was modern, very clean, spacious, and well equipped. The 2 balconies gave us some nice views, and the king size bed was a dream to sleep on. The kitchen was a really nice touch, and would probably satisfy a budding chef. Sparkling bathroom, with a great shower and a large tub. We managed to visit the pool complex, and were blown away! Three pools (one was a genuine lap pool), a spa, and a sauna. The gym looked to be very well appointed too. Staff/Service - The staff were the best I have experienced at a hotel. We arrived at about 10:30am, and rather than just holding our bags, the staff checked us in early! They were more than happy to hold our bags until departure, and offered to organise a taxi for us. We were always greeted with smiling faces, and our requests, though few, were met with ease. I thoroughly recommend the Meriton Cameo to anyone visiting Sydney. Those worried about being out of the city, don't. It was a breeze to get there. There is plenty of nightlife/activities to keep you occupied in Surry Hills. You won't find a hotel in the city as good as the Meriton for less than double the price. Truly a top-shelf stay!

Reviews.Title: “Carefree Cameo”
Reviews.Author: Major_Delays
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night at the cameo aprtments, but for under Â£100 a night the accomodation was exceptional. We stayed in a beautiful 2 bed apartment which appeared to be brand new. The only thing which detracted from the stay was location a little out of the city, but still only a $12 taxi ride (5 minutes) to circular quay. The staff at reception were friendly and helpful (organising taxis etc.) and we were very pleased with the whole experience. With a little more experience of the public transport system I would say that this is an ideal base for a Sydney holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain price if you know where to look”
Reviews.Author: DJBSydney
Reviews.Content: My mother and my sisters family of four needed somewhere to stay while visiting me in Sydney so booked a 2 bed apartment through the wotif site a week before they got here. Very good value for money and if you are capable of getting into the city by yourself by bus(15-30mins) or taxi and don't want a broom cupboard for a room then these newly built a/c apartments with kitchen and access to a 30m pool,gym, sauna, jacuzzi across the road might be for you. Service - Like most things a bit hit and miss depending who you get (hit - receptionist provides us with access to car park to drop off families luggage and efficient check in, miss - a/c not working so after reporting it (guy notes it on writing pad) he says 'thanks' and stares blankly at you - no feedback on when it's going to be fixed - doh!) If you're here on w/e's there is some cool brekkie spots around the area - Danks St Depot and others. Not far from Cleveland street too which has a good few restuarants to eat in the evening too. For bars walk (15mins) up to Surrey Hills - White Horse, Clock hotel, Dolphin hotel, Foresters. Not so easy to get to the beaches though without a car although possible by going into the centre and then out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: alnewell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on our first trip to Sydney. We had a 1 bedroom apartment, and were really pleased with the size of apartment and facilities offered (all very clean and new). Really good to have your own washing machine/dryer at the end of a month long trip in Oz! There's a bus stop just outside which takes you into the centre of Sydney (about 15 mins). You can also walk to Fox Studios, and find shops/bars etc, and other local neighbourhoods. We would definitely think about staying there again. Highly recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Meriton Serviced Apartments Danks Street, Waterloo
HotelInfo.Address: 30 Danks Street | Waterloo, Sydney, New South Wales 2017, Australia
